full_summary:
**5P468-23-0257/B – Walker Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park**
==========================================================

**Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Publication Date:** March 27, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** April 10, 2024, 16:00:00

**Expected Contract Start Date:** May 3, 2024

**Expected Contract End Date:** November 30, 2024

**Procurement Category:** CNST

**Industry Classification:** 72141107 - Bridge Construction and Repair Service

**Value Estimate:** $1,000,001 to $5,000,000 (GST exclusive)

**Site Location:** Grasslands National Park, Saskatchewan

**Contracting Entity:** Parks Canada

**Background:** Parks Canada requires the replacement of the Walker Bridge over the Frenchman River located in Grasslands National Park. The project involves maintaining an existing temporary detour, constructing a new concrete and steel short-span bridge, realigning the gravel grid road to the new bridge, demolishing the existing timber bridge and road access, and restoring the site. The work must be completed by November 30, 2024.

**Instructions to Bidders:** Bidders must submit their qualification in two stages. Stage 1 will assess the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and Stage 2 will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project. Bidders must submit their bid in two phases, with the first phase evaluating their technical qualifications and the second phase evaluating their financial bid.

**Submission Requirements:**

* Bids will be accepted via email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca or fax to 1-855-983-1808.
* Bidders must submit their bid documentation in 15 megabyte or smaller email attachments.
* Bidders must use the specified envelope format, with two separate envelopes for technical and price evaluations.
* Late submissions will not be considered.

**Enquiry Procedure:** Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at least five business days prior to the tender closing date. Enquiries received after this deadline may not receive a response.

**Additional Information:** National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
